doc.after: The ancestors of Pennsylvania German speakers came from various parts of the southwest corner of the German speaking region of Europe mainly the Palatinate but also including the Electorate of the Palatinate German Kurpfalz the Duchy of Baden Swabia W rttemberg Alsace German Elsass and Switzerland Most of them spoke Rhine Franconian especially Palatinan and to a lesser degree Alemannic dialects and in the first generations after the settlers arrived it is believed that these dialects merged citation needed The result of that dialect levelling was a dialect very close to the eastern dialects of Palatinian especially the rural dialects around Mannheim Ludwigshafen
